required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study to Test the Pharmacokinetics, Efficacy, and Safety of Brivaracetam in Newborns With Repeated Electroencephalographic Seizures
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter, Open-label, Single-arm Study to Evaluate the Pharmacokinetics, Efficacy, and Safety of Brivaracetam in Neonates With Repeated Electroencephalographic Seizures

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to evaluate the pharmacokinetics (PK) of brivaracetam (BRV) in neonates who have seizures that are not adequately controlled with phenobarbital (PB) treatment and to identify the optimal BRV dose (Exploratory Cohort) for the treatment of subjects enrolled into the Confirmatory Cohorts of this study

primary_outcome.time_frame: 30-60 min after the BRV infusion on day 1
primary_outcome.description: Pharmacokinetic blood samples will be taken 30-60 min after the BRV infusion on day 1 to determine the BRV plasma concentration.

primary_outcome.measure: Plasma concentration of the BRV metabolite ucb-42145 (acid)
primary_outcome.time_frame: 30-60 min after the BRV infusion on day 1
primary_outcome.description: Pharmacokinetic blood samples will be taken 30-60 min after the BRV infusion on day 1 to determine the BRV metabolite ucb-42145 plasma concentration.

primary_outcome.measure: Plasma concentration of the BRV metabolite ucb-100406-1 (hydroxy)
primary_outcome.time_frame: 30-60 min after the BRV infusion on day 1
primary_outcome.description: Pharmacokinetic blood samples will be taken 30-60 min after the BRV infusion on day 1 to determine the BRV metabolite ucb-100406-1 plasma concentration.

primary_outcome.measure: Plasma concentration of the BRV metabolite ucb-107092-1 (hydroxyacid)
primary_outcome.time_frame: 30-60 min after the BRV infusion on day 1
primary_outcome.description: Pharmacokinetic blood samples will be taken 30-60 min after the BRV infusion on day 1 to determine the BRV metabolite ucb-107092-1 plasma concentration.

primary_outcome.measure: Area under the BRV plasma concentration time curve (AUC)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Samples will be collected 30-60 min, 2-4 hours, and 8-12 hours after the BRV infusion on day 1 and potentially on day 2 for the exploratory cohort and on day 1 and day 2, or on day 1 and day 3, or on day 1 and day 4 for the confirmatory cohorts.
primary_outcome.description: AUC is the area under the BRV plasma concentration time curve. Pharmacokinetic blood samples will be taken at indicated timepoints.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Samples will be collected 30-60 min, 2-4 hours, and 8-12 hours after the BRV infusion on day 1 and potentially on day 2 for the exploratory cohort and on day 1 and day 2, or on day 1 and day 3, or on day 1 and day 4 for the confirmatory cohorts.
primary_outcome.description: AUC is the area under the BRV plasma concentration time curve. Pharmacokinetic blood samples will be taken at indicated timepoints.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Samples will be collected 30-60 min, 2-4 hours, and 8-12 hours after the BRV infusion on day 1 and potentially on day 2 for the exploratory cohort and on day 1 and day 2, or on day 1 and day 3, or on day 1 and day 4 for the confirmatory cohorts.
primary_outcome.description: AUC is the area under the BRV plasma concentration time curve. Pharmacokinetic blood samples will be taken at indicated timepoints.

primary_outcome.measure: Plasma concentration of the concomitant antiepileptic drug phenobarbital (PB)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Samples will be collected 3 hours after the initial dose of BRV.
primary_outcome.description: Pharmacokinetic blood samples will be taken 3 hours after the initial dose of BRV to determine the phenobarbital plasma concentration.

primary_outcome.measure: Plasma concentration of the concomitant antiepileptic drug phenytoin (PHT)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Samples will be collected 3 hours after the initial dose of BRV.
primary_outcome.description: Pharmacokinetic blood samples will be taken 3 hours after the initial dose of BRV to determine the phenytoin plasma concentration.

primary_outcome.time_frame: 2-4 hours after the BRV infusion on day 1
primary_outcome.description: Pharmacokinetic blood samples will be taken 2-4 hours after the BRV infusion on day 1 to determine the BRV plasma concentration.

primary_outcome.time_frame: 8-12 hours after the BRV infusion on day 1
primary_outcome.description: Pharmacokinetic blood samples will be taken 8-12 hours after the BRV infusion on day 1 to determine the BRV plasma concentration.

primary_outcome.measure: Plasma concentration of the BRV metabolite ucb-42145 (acid)
primary_outcome.time_frame: 2-4 hours after the BRV infusion on day 1
primary_outcome.description: Pharmacokinetic blood samples will be taken 2-4 hours after the BRV infusion on day 1 to determine the BRV metabolite ucb-42145 plasma concentration.

primary_outcome.measure: Plasma concentration of the BRV metabolite ucb-42145 (acid)
primary_outcome.time_frame: 8-12 hours after the BRV infusion on day 1
primary_outcome.description: Pharmacokinetic blood samples will be taken 8-12 hours after the BRV infusion on day 1 to determine the BRV metabolite ucb-42145 plasma concentration.

primary_outcome.measure: Plasma concentration of the BRV metabolite ucb-100406-1 (hydroxy)
primary_outcome.time_frame: 2-4 hours after the BRV infusion on day 1
primary_outcome.description: Pharmacokinetic blood samples will be taken 2-4 hours after the BRV infusion on day 1 to determine the BRV metabolite ucb-100406-1 plasma concentration.

primary_outcome.measure: Plasma concentration of the BRV metabolite ucb-100406-1 (hydroxy)
primary_outcome.time_frame: 8-12 hours after the BRV infusion on day 1
primary_outcome.description: Pharmacokinetic blood samples will be taken 8-12 hours after the BRV infusion on day 1 to determine the BRV metabolite ucb-100406-1 plasma concentration.

primary_outcome.measure: Plasma concentration of the BRV metabolite ucb-107092-1 (hydroxyacid)
primary_outcome.time_frame: 2-4 hours after the BRV infusion on day 1
primary_outcome.description: Pharmacokinetic blood samples will be taken 2-4 hours after the BRV infusion on day 1 to determine the BRV metabolite ucb-107092-1 plasma concentration.

primary_outcome.measure: Plasma concentration of the BRV metabolite ucb-107092-1 (hydroxyacid)
primary_outcome.time_frame: 8-12 hours after the BRV infusion on day 1
primary_outcome.description: Pharmacokinetic blood samples will be taken 8-12 hours after the BRV infusion on day 1 to determine the BRV metabolite ucb-107092-1 plasma concentration.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of responders to BRV treatment from Baseline to 3 hours after the initial BRV dose
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Baseline to 3 hours after the initial BRV dose
secondary_outcome.description: A BRV responder is defined as a subject who achieves the following reduction in seizure burden (electroencephalographic neonatal seizures (ENS) in minutes per hour) compared to the seizure burden measured during the 2-hour Baseline Period immediately prior to BRV administration, evaluated for a 2-hour period starting 1 hour after the start of initial BRV treatment: At least 80% reduction in nonsevere seizure burden (Nonsevere seizure burden is defined as <=50% seizure activity on (multichannel) video-electroencephalography (VEEG) in any 30-minute timespan) OR At least 50% reduction in severe seizure burden (Severe seizure burden is defined as >50% seizure activity on VEEG in any 30-minute timespan). Timespans of 30 minutes can refer to the following intervals within the 2-hour period: 0 to <= 30 minutes, > 30 to <= 60 minutes, >60 to <= 90 minutes, and >90 to <= 120 minutes.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of subjects with at least 80% reduction in nonsevere seizure burden from Baseline to 3 hours after the initial BRV treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Baseline to 3 hours after the initial BRV treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Nonsevere seizure burden is defined as <=50% seizure activity on VEEG in any 30-minute timespan. Timespans of 30 minutes can refer to the following intervals within the 2-hour period: 0 to <= 30 minutes, > 30 to <= 60 minutes, >60 to <= 90 minutes, and >90 to <= 120 minutes.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of subjects with at least 50% reduction in severe seizure burden from Baseline to 3 hours after the initial BRV treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Baseline to 3 hours after the initial BRV treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Severe seizure burden is defined as >50% seizure activity on VEEG in any 30-minute timespan. Timespans of 30 minutes can refer to the following intervals within the 2-hour period: 0 to <= 30 minutes, > 30 to <= 60 minutes, >60 to <= 90 minutes, and >90 to <= 120 minutes.

secondary_outcome.measure: Absolute change in average seizure burden measured by continuous VEEG from Baseline to the end of the 96-hour Evaluation Period
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Baseline to the end of the 96-hour Evaluation Period
secondary_outcome.description: Seizure burden will be measured by continuous (multichannel) video-electroencephalography (VEEG). Baseline seizure burden is defined as seizure burden measured on the continuous VEEG (total ENS in minutes per hour) during a period of 2 hours immediately prior to the first administration of study drug.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage change in average seizure burden measured by continuous VEEG from Baseline to the end of the 96-hour Evaluation Period
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Baseline to the end of the 96-hour Evaluation Period
secondary_outcome.description: Seizure burden will be measured by continuous (multichannel) video-electroencephalography (VEEG). Baseline seizure burden is defined as seizure burden measured on the continuous VEEG (total ENS in minutes per hour) during a period of 2 hours immediately prior to the first administration of study drug.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of BRV responders at the end of the 96-hour Evaluation Period
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Baseline to the end of the 96-hour Evaluation Period
secondary_outcome.description: A BRV responder is defined as a subject who achieves the following reduction in seizure burden (electroencephalographic neonatal seizures (ENS) in minutes per hour) without the need for rescue medication, compared to the seizure burden measured during a 2-hour Baseline Period immediately prior to BRV administration, evaluated for a 2-hour period starting 1 hour after the start of initial BRV treatment: At least 80% reduction in nonsevere seizure burden (Nonsevere seizure burden is defined as <=50% seizure activity on VEEG in any 30-minute timespan) OR At least 50% reduction in severe seizure burden (Severe seizure burden is defined as >50% seizure activity on VEEG in any 30-minute timespan)

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of subjects who are seizure-free (100% reduction in seizure burden from Baseline) at 24 hours following the start of initial BRV treatment, categorized by subjects with nonsevere or severe seizure burden at Baseline
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Baseline to 24 hours after the initial BRV treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Seizure freedom is defined as 100% reduction in seizure burden from Baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to reduction in seizure burden for BRV responders
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Baseline to the first timepoint when BRV responder criteria is met
secondary_outcome.description: A BRV responder is defined as a subject who achieves the following reduction in seizure burden (electroencephalographic neonatal seizures (ENS) in minutes per hour) without the need for rescue medication, compared to the seizure burden measured during a 2-hour Baseline Period immediately prior to BRV administration, evaluated for a 2-hour period starting 1 hour after the start of initial BRV treatment: At least 80% reduction in nonsevere seizure burden (Nonsevere seizure burden is defined as <=50% seizure activity on VEEG in any 30-minute timespan) OR At least 50% reduction in severe seizure burden (Severe seizure burden is defined as >50% seizure activity on VEEG in any 30-minute timespan)

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Subjects with Seizure Freedom at the end of Down-Titration Period
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Baseline to the end of the Down-Titration Period
secondary_outcome.description: Seizure freedom is defined as 100% reduction in seizure burden from Baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Subjects with at least 50% reduction in electroencephalographic neonatal seizures (ENS) frequency per hour from Baseline to the end of the 96-hour Evaluation Period
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Baseline to the end of the 96-hour Evaluation Period
secondary_outcome.description: For this study, an ENS is defined as an EEG seizure lasting for at least 10 seconds on VEEG. Baseline seizure burden is defined as seizure burden measured on the continuous VEEG (total ENS in minutes per hour) during a period of 2 hours immediately prior to the first administration of study drug.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of subjects who are seizure-free by time interval over the 96-hour evaluation period
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From 3 hours following the start of the initial BRV treatment to the end of the 96-hour Evaluation Period
secondary_outcome.description: Seizure freedom is defined as 100% reduction in seizure burden from Baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Absolute difference in clinical seizures at the end of the 24-hour Evaluation Period from Baseline for neonates with motor seizures at the time of inclusion
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Baseline to the end of the 24-hour Evaluation Period
secondary_outcome.description: Seizures will be measured by continuous (multichannel) video-electroencephalography (VEEG).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent difference in clinical seizures at the end of the 24-hour Evaluation Period from Baseline for neonates with motor seizures at the time of inclusion
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Baseline to the end of the 24-hour Evaluation Period
secondary_outcome.description: Seizures will be measured by continuous (multichannel) video-electroencephalography (VEEG).

secondary_outcome.measure: Absolute change from Baseline in seizure burden by time interval over the 96-hour evaluation period
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Baseline to the end of the 96-hour Evaluation Period
secondary_outcome.description: Seizure burden will be measured by continuous (multichannel) video-electroencephalography (VEEG). Baseline seizure burden is defined as seizure burden measured on the continuous VEEG (total ENS in minutes per hour) during a period of 2 hours immediately prior to the first administration of study drug.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage change from Baseline in seizure burden by time interval over the 96-hour evaluation period
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Baseline to the end of the 96-hour Evaluation Period
secondary_outcome.description: Seizure burden will be measured by continuous (multichannel) video-electroencephalography (VEEG). Baseline seizure burden is defined as seizure burden measured on the continuous VEEG (total ENS in minutes per hour) during a period of 2 hours immediately prior to the first administration of study drug.

secondary_outcome.measure: Categorized percentage change from Baseline to the end of the 96-hour Evaluation Period in seizure burden
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Baseline to the end of the 96-hour Evaluation Period
secondary_outcome.description: Categories are as follows: <-25% (worsening), -25% to <25% (no change), 25% to <50%, 50% to <80%, and >=80%

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of responders to BRV treatment by time interval over the 96-hour evaluation period
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Baseline to the end of the 96-hour Evaluation Period
secondary_outcome.description: A BRV responder is defined as a subject who achieves the following reduction in seizure burden (electroencephalographic neonatal seizures (ENS) in minutes per hour) without the need for rescue medication, compared to the seizure burden measured during a 2-hour Baseline Period immediately prior to BRV administration, evaluated for a 2-hour period starting 1 hour after the start of initial BRV treatment: At least 80% reduction in nonsevere seizure burden (Nonsevere seizure burden is defined as <=50% seizure activity on VEEG in any 30-minute timespan) OR At least 50% reduction in severe seizure burden (Severe seizure burden is defined as >50% seizure activity on VEEG in any 30-minute timespan)

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of subjects who switch over from BRV to another antiepileptic drug (AED) during the 96-hour Evaluation Period
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the 96-hour Evaluation Period
secondary_outcome.description: Subjects can switch over from BRV to another AED [eg, midazolam (MDZ) or phenytoin (PHT)], if needed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of responders to other treatment from Baseline to the end of the 96-hour Evaluation Period
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Baseline to the end of the 96-hour Evaluation Period
secondary_outcome.description: A responder to other treatment is defined as at least 80% reduction in nonsevere seizure burden from start of other treatment to end of other treatment or at least 50% reduction in severe seizure burden from the initiation of other treatment to end of other treatment during the 96-hour Evaluation Period

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of responders to other treatment by time interval over the 96-hour evaluation period
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Baseline to the end of the 96-hour Evaluation Period
secondary_outcome.description: A responder to other treatment is defined as at least 80% reduction in nonsevere seizure burden from start of other treatment to end of other treatment or at least 50% reduction in severe seizure burden from the initiation of other treatment to end of other treatment during the 96-hour Evaluation Period

intervention.description: Exploratory Cohort: Subsequent to one or multiple therapeutic doses of midazolam ([MDZ], dose and dosing frequency of MDZ is at the discretion of the investigator), a low dose of Brivaracetam (BRV) intravenous (iv) solution for injection will be administered. At the discretion of the Investigator, 3 additional iv BRV doses, up to a total of 4 iv BRV doses (0.5mg/kg twice daily [bid]), can be administered during the 48-hour Evaluation Period. Confirmatory Cohort: During the Evaluation Period, subjects are expected to receive intravenous (iv) BRV bid. The dose and dosing frequency of BRV will be adjusted for the Confirmatory Cohorts based on the analysis of the data collected for the Exploratory Cohort.
Subjects can switch from intravenous (iv) to oral brivaracetam (BRV) at any time during the BRV Extension Period

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Confirmation on video-electroencephalography (VEEG) of >= 2 minutes of cumulative electroencephalographic neonatal seizures (ENS), or >=3 identifiable ENS within the 2 hours prior to entering the Evaluation Period, despite receiving phenobarbital (PB) for the treatment of repeated seizures prior to Baseline. The occurrence of ENS during the 2-hour period must be confirmed either by the local or central VEEG reader prior to drug administration. Preferably, the central VEEG reader should confirm the required ENS. If a qualified VEEG reader is available, a local VEEG reader may be used.
- Subject is male or female with an age at birth of 34 weeks to less than 42 weeks of gestational age (GA) and up to 28 days of postnatal age at the time of enrollment
- Subject weighs at least 2.3 kg at the time of enrollment
- Subjects with or without concomitant hypothermia treatment
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subject received antiepileptic drug (AED) treatment (other than the required 1 to 3 doses of phenobarbital (PB) [total therapeutic administered dose of 20 to 40mg/kg] for the treatment of repeated seizures) prior to entering the Evaluation Period.
- Subject with seizures responding to PB (total therapeutic administered dose of 20 to 40mg/kg), pyridoxine treatment, or correction of metabolic disturbances (hypoglycemia, hypomagnesemia or hypocalcemia)
- Subject has a poor prognosis for survival, as judged by the Investigator
- Subject has 2x upper limit of normal (ULN) of any of the following: aspartate aminotransferase (AST), alanine aminotransferase (ALT), and alkaline phosphatase (ALP) with the following exception: For subjects with perinatal asphyxia, elevation of ALT, AST or ALP up to 5 x ULN is acceptable, if initial and peak elevation of liver function tests (LFTs) occurs within 5 days after birth, and if the time course of LFT elevation is compatible with hepatic injury due to perinatal asphyxia. The determinations of ULN will be based on the subject's gestational age (GA) and the site's normal range values for the respective GA
- Subject requiring or expected to require phototherapy or exchange transfusion due to elevated bilirubin
- Subject with rapidly increasing bilirubin that may preclude the subject from inclusion in the study at the discretion of the Investigator
- Subject requires extra corporeal membrane oxygenation
- Subject has seizures related to prenatal maternal drug use or drug withdrawal
- Subject has known severe disturbance of hemostasis, as assessed by the Investigator
